revised_title: Flicker and Binocular Vision: Observations on Hippolyte's Color Patterns
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the relationship between the two retinae in binocular vision and the "flicker" method of photometry. They observed the effects of different light frequencies, durations, and intensities on the perception of color patterns in the zooplankton Hippolyte. The findings provide insights into the physiological luminosity and brightness differences between binocular and uniocular vision.
